text:
Agreed.
What's even more interesting is that the supported roles for in-place upgrade
can change with CUs.
Had to get a standalone 2012 R2 VM with RDSH role installed moved over to 2019
in a hurry towards the end of last year (OneDrive + storage issues; what a
surprise).
When I initially lab-tested 2012 R2 to 2019 in-place upgrades within 6 months of
2019 release, 2019 would detect the RDSH role and tell you to uninstall the
role, upgrade, then re-enable the role which was fine, but annoying.
Skip to late last year and the up-to-date 2019 ISO was happy to in-place upgrade
the 2012 R2 RDSH VM to 2019 without requiring the RDSH role to be uninstalled. 
On Fri, 9 Feb 2024 at 01:38, 'CR Hiestand' via PatchManagement
<
%40mail.gmail.com

metadata.subject: Re: [patchmanagement] Extended Security Updates for Server 2012R2
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from stryqx@gmail.com. Learn why this is important
[https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification]
